results.title: Heaven
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: Surfing, sexuality and masculine bodies beneath the female gaze. A handheld camera closes in on private space of surfers as they disrobe in carparks and attempts to catch them ‘out’. Filmed in and around Sydney beaches, Moffatt and female friends have documented a playful but edgey representation of surfer culture as the interaction between the filmmaker and subject moves towards active voyerism. The heavy drum beats and lapping waves of the soundtrack mirror the thrill and excitement of gender mis-representation. How do the males react, or perform, on camera and how do audiences interpret their own voyeuristic desires? What does it suggest about the role of the film maker, of ethics or ‘surveillance’?

results.title: Fire of time
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: Urban development in Barcelona has all but destroyed the once vibrant Barrio Chino where the nights were days and the days were long. This is an evocative film shot through windows, on street corners and in small rooms. People, clouds, and the swift tail lights of cars glide past and through, as fleeting traces of the passage of time. And as this one working-class Red Light district is transformed and changed by the process of gentrification, the former residents appear as ghosts, their prescence - as graffiti, as shadows - a reminder of the real history of the city. Larger forces cause buildings and neighbourhoods to vanish but they are rebuilt again in memories, worn photographs and in light. Adam Cohen’s handling of light gives people the substance of phantoms and their passages through the half deserted streets evoke Eliot, Proust, and Chris Marker. Sounds of this world are orchestrated with cello, organ and guitar to form a profoundly beautiful work about memory, longing and loss.

results.title: Visions of Victoria
results.creator_credit: Janne Martin Video Productions and Stewart Faichney
results.brief_description:
On a continent distinguished for its unique mixture of climates and for its exotic wildlife, there is no state that provides more variety and contrast than Victoria. Occupying the south-east corner of Australia, and only slightly larger than the size of Great Britain, Victoria has something for everybody. This video takes you on a remarkable tour of the state of Victoria which includes the wilderness areas of its world famous national parks, some of the best surf beaches in the world, Australia’s largest inland lagoon system, a rugged shipwrecked coast, winter resorts and high country, wetlands and even deserts. Also the vibrant and sophisticated city of Melbourne, renowned for its beautiful parks and gardens, exciting restaurants and nightlife, its devotion to the arts and, of course, a fanatical love of sports of all kinds. This superb video is a comprehensive celebration of this wonderful state, in all its beauty, seasons and moods.

Note: the end has a segment on film classification showing Bill Collins introducing the “G” rating.

results.title: [Democracy]
results.creator_credit: Michael Rubetzki, South Australian Film Corporation and Henri Safran
results.brief_description: This film is aimed at conveying to young people the value and importance of the vote. Actors portray representatives of the community such as: farmers, mechanics, clergymen and teenagers as they pass symbolically through the various evolutionary forms of government, including the monarchical system, military dictatorship, extremism and participatory democracy.

results.title: Beautiful brown eyes
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, David Facey and ACMI
results.brief_description: When David Facey’s daughter was born the first thing he fell in love with was her beautiful brown eyes. Ironically, it was those same eyes that told him something wasn’t quite right.

results.title: Vicki's story
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Vicki Atkinson
results.brief_description: Vicki reminisces about her family and childhood and how she looked up to her parents as role models hoping that what she has learned from them can be passed on to her own two daughters. This is her message.
